RT @ClarkeCary: Join me tonight @ 6pm Pacific for a panel discussion I'm moderating on the state of all-ages music access + organizing in P‚Ä¶

It should be easy to understand why someone might oppose paywalls for lifesaving academic research but be supportive of paywalls for the Washington Post, if that‚Äôs what helps them keep journalists employed.  We have to think beyond sloganeering.

If we resist the urge to craft grand theories about IP and instead look at specific use cases, we can approach the relevant issues in a more humane and less binary way, one that has a strong conception of the public good, but also a strong conception of creative rights.
@Vrijschrift The issues with access to research are real, as we have written before. https://t.co/WNNr1UX1R7

You could potentially copyright advertising and marketing materials.  But anyone who tells you that copyright is creating a barrier to access to prescription drugs, vaccines etc is‚Äîat best‚Äîconfused.  What‚Äôs at issue there is patents.
You can‚Äôt copyright a prescription drug.  You can patent it, and you can trademark the name.
Copyright and patent and trademarks are very different.   Conflating them leads to confusion, drives polarization and makes it harder to achieve just and equitable public policy.

Great new resources on understanding copyright from @CopyrightOffice https://t.co/W2uxp00xmx
@michael_hrivnak Admittedly though, those folks get more worked up if you try and introduce resale restrictions or holdbacks/setasides Instead of just facilitating pre-sales.

@michael_hrivnak The argument is that it‚Äôs an inefficient allocation of value, and that the secondary market is inherently good for consumers because it allows market forces to prevail unencumbered.
@laintrepida Right now, radio pays artists nothing in the United States, and as long as that‚Äôs true, digital services can always say ‚Äúwell, we pay better than radio does!‚Äù

@laintrepida There isn‚Äôt a silver bullet solution, in part because the artist community is so diverse. There are lots of smaller things that would help improve the situation. For example: plugging the gaps that currently exist that deflate the marketplace, like radio and YouTube.

This is not a defense of Spotify, nor of Rogan, whose comments on vaccines and trans people are inexcusable.  Rather, we need to look at the fundamental problems with the model, as well as dysfunction in the broader marketplace.

The answer is unsatisfying:  the 100M to Joe Rogan over multiple years is maybe 1% of overall royalties.  Spotify could kill that deal and give all that money to artists/rightsholders through an improved rate and it wouldn‚Äôt make a meaningful difference. https://t.co/V7wYlEE9ti

The best economists, of course, embrace complexity and engage with the lived experience of workers and other citizens.  And when they look at industries where they‚Äôre not specialists, they tend to operate from a place of curiosity.

Economists often tend to see things through the lens of economic theory, and while that can generate insights, it can cause problems, especially with a field like music, which is driven by a whole range of non-economic factors. Market dynamics can‚Äôt tell you the whole story.

Here is an example of how some artists try and keep tickets off the secondary market to better serve fans. Some economists would say this is ‚Äúbad for consumers.‚Äù Economists can be pretty weird! https://t.co/4H6oz0NIB2

@dada_drummer @MrTomGray Yes, but it‚Äôs gonna take some organizing.  Right now, the priority is to keep members of Congress off the ‚Äúlocal radio freedom act‚Äù which is a resolution the broadcast lobby introduces every congressional session as a vehicle for expressing opposition to the performance right.

@dada_drummer @MrTomGray With radio right now, it‚Äôs most fundamentally about the structural power of the broadcast lobby. They have stations in every congressional district.  And they scare stations into believing that paying artists would put them out of business.

@MrTomGray @dada_drummer The lack of a performance right on US radio is inexcusable.  It‚Äôs part of why royalty rates on digital are lower than they ought to be, and so it impacts all artists, not just those who get radio airplay.  Fixing that is a central priority for us.
@dada_drummer And they use those direct deals to achieve savings on licensing costs.

@dada_drummer What happens with Sirius is a good example.  Sirius has the ability to play whatever they want via the statutory.  But they still aggressively pursue direct deals; they have the power to choose not to play  artists (or play them less) if they don‚Äôt agree to Sirius‚Äô terms.

@dada_drummer Also, it isn‚Äôt giving artists another choice if artists aren‚Äôt the ones choosing.  Spotify already has the option of paying for noninteractive plays through the statutory.  All that said, we love Soundexchange and direct payment and equitable splits.

@dada_drummer Artists and labels will have a variety of views on that question, but it probably isn‚Äôt realistic to imagine that people are going to rally behind a licensing scheme that forces artists to make everything they put on Bandcamp also available through Amazon or Spotify.

@dada_drummer Sound recording rightsholders and services may still agree to send noninteractive royalties for nonstatutory uses through Soundexchange for administrative purposes, so artists may not even know that it‚Äôs not being handled through the statutory.

@dada_drummer A service doesn‚Äôt have to use the statutory rate for everything it plays noninteractively.   They can just use the statutory to pay for whatever music they haven‚Äôt gotten covered under direct deals.

@dada_drummer Services that offer both noninteractive and interactive options tend to have licensing infrastructure to facilitate direct deals.  And licensing deals for all service options are usually struck simultaneously.    The use of the statutory is more limited.

@dada_drummer When a particular offering is classified as ‚Äúnoninteractive‚Äù, it doesn‚Äôt mean the service is forced to pay a royalty it wouldn‚Äôt otherwise have to pay, or required to license a certain way.   It just means the service has access to the statutory option.

@dada_drummer Additionally, when something is classified as noninteractive, services can still negotiate direct deals that don‚Äôt use regulated rates or splits or payment structures; they don‚Äôt even have to send the money through Soundexchange if they‚Äôre not employing the statutory license.

@dada_drummer That‚Äôs a reasonable take; of course there‚Äôs a risk that a regulated rate ends up being lower than a negotiated rate, and most statutory proposals we have seen would force artists to allow their music on Spotify or Amazon etc regardless of whether they want it there.
@dada_drummer Guaranteed splits would be great but...If Spotify were classified as noninteractive it would pay much much less than it currently does.
The worst has been a report on ‚Äúthe new creative economy‚Äù defined to include people who sell thrift store and flea market stuff on Etsy. https://t.co/mlc08mumAS

Ethically, structurally, technically, and often legally, music copyright is distinct from issues like access to research, prescription drugs, biotech patents, trademarks and etc. All those issues are thorny and complex, and best addressed without the weight of the others.

Reminder:  prescription drug patents and music copyrights don't have much to do with each other, and while it might feel nice to bundle everything into a big unifying theory of "intellectual property," that can actually be counterproductive. https://t.co/jdhk6VGCAl

Limiting contracts to 7 years--like all other contracts in California--isn't a silver bullet, but it would help avoid those kind of circumstances and rebalance the power dynamics.  https://t.co/qUfoA8W4UY

At times, artists have gotten trapped in contracts where labels won't release their record because they "don't hear a single", the original A&R team the artist worked with isn't at the label anymore, and the artist is stuck in limbo unable to move their career forward.

Not every artist needs a label, but labels, even major labels, can be good partners to artists under the right circumstances, helping them achieve creative goals and reach audiences.  Sometimes, though, the balance of power is way off.

California's state legislature is considering the #FAIRact.  In California, contracts can only last 7 years.  Unless you're an actor under contract with a movie studio or recording artist under contract with a record label.  (THREAD)

It's impossible to meet the real Jesus and leave indifferent.
To insist others keep their religious beliefs private is itself an unprovable quasi-religious belief.
Accepting Jesus Christ requires humility because you're admitting that you can't save yourself by your own means.

Jesus is one of the following: Lord, Lunatic, Liar, or a Legend. Only four possibilities. Most people don't die for lie (probably not a liar). Not a Legend-too many eyewitnesses (see https://t.co/Cpk3kgar7C), and based on his teachings hard to label him a lunatic.
The book of Genesis leaves us with a striking truth - work was part of paradise and before the Fall.
To spell this out...He lost Jerusalem so that we gain the new city in Rev 21-22.

Your heart can‚Äôt bear the pain & anguish anymore. You‚Äôre not alone. You feel distressed. You‚Äôre not alone. You need to be patient with what the Almighty has planned for you. For how long, you ask? He will decide on the best time! The more patient you are, the greater your reward!

Almighty. We ask You to help us realise our #Ramadan goal in getting closer to You. Soften the hearts of those who‚Äôve yet to feel the sweetness of this blessed month; don‚Äôt let them give in to despair. Give them the strength to keep trying. We ask for Your Mercy & Forgiveness.

Don‚Äôt get complacent with your blessings. The more grateful you are, the more the Almighty will send your way. The way forward is to keep nurturing what you already have. Learn to appreciate His Gifts. To be grateful is to find blessings in everything. A powerful attitude!

If you‚Äôre feeling down and depressed at the moment, you have to believe that you‚Äôll experience the favours of the Almighty in unexpected and unusual ways. For as long as you trust Him, He will turn your troubles, challenges and hardship in your favour. Bear patience!

Never forget who‚Äôs in control of every aspect of your existence. So don‚Äôt let your grief consume you. Try to step away from your broken state, even if just for a moment. You‚Äôll see things clearer; realise that you own nothing at all. Everything‚Äôs on loan from the Almighty!

Strengthen your link with your Maker. Don‚Äôt lose heart. Each day we‚Äôre being challenged from the outside and inside. But stay firm because for all your worldly troubles, eternal bliss awaits you. Focus on the task at hand and know that it‚Äôs temporary. Stay motivated!

What a judgemental society we live in! People will form their own conclusions of you based on a tweet or a Facebook status.  They judge your appearance, accent, the way you dress etc. Just because you‚Äôre different from them, they look down on you. Stand your ground. Be polite!

No matter how much good you do or how much others value you, there will always be that one person who doesn‚Äôt like you. So be it. Such is life. Remember, you‚Äôre not everyone‚Äôs cup of tea and that‚Äôs ok. The sooner you accept it, the easier it becomes to move on with your life.
RT @KagutaMuseveni: Meeting the respectable @muftimenk at the state lodge in Kyankwanzi this evening. I am in agreement with his teachings‚Ä¶

Disappointment mostly comes about because of your expectations; not because of other people‚Äôs behavior. Accept the fact that people will let you down. Time & again. They‚Äôll show you their true colours eventually. Learn to expect only from the One who made you. He always delivers!

The Almighty will never ignore your pleas. He will never leave you empty-handed. He will replace everything you‚Äôve lost. He will give you something even better when you leave whatever He has prohibited & disallowed.  That‚Äôs how merciful He is & He always wants the best for us!

We're almost at the halfway mark in #Ramadan.  For those striving hard, keep going. For the rest, it's never too late. The most crucial thing is to finish strong as we enter the last ten nights. The Almighty knows & sees all our efforts, no matter how small. So give it your all!

If you take care of your relationship with the Almighty, He will care of you in ways you never imagined. So nurture the relationship and build that bond. He will grant you the strength you need. He is always building you up even when it seems like He‚Äôs breaking you. Trust Him.

Don‚Äôt wait to turn back to the Almighty. Do it in these blessed days of #Ramadan. The sooner, the better. Seek Him. Thank Him & you‚Äôre on the road to a better life. It‚Äôs a misconception to wait for things to be prefect before you pray. Things will never be perfect. Start now!

When you do things the Almighty‚Äôs way, you‚Äôre a winner. Every time. It may not be apparent immediately but it will surely show up eventually. Satan will always intervene. Be sure to protect yourself against His whisperings. Be strong. Remain steadfast and don‚Äôt cave in!

Don‚Äôt block your blessings by being bitter about someone else‚Äôs. Keep gratitude alive in your heart. After all, the Almighty has given you more than what you‚Äôve asked for; with more on the way. Recognize that because He can take it away anytime. Being grateful will increase it!

Life can be short and unpredictable. You need to come to terms with this and when you finally do, you‚Äôd give up a lot of the unnecessary stress that you cause for yourself. It also becomes easier to give up all the drama, let go of grudges and value what you have in your life!

Never say you've nothing to offer someone who's down & needs help. A listening ear, a word of encouragement, kindness or even a smile can lift the person out of his doldrums. Be generous with whatever the Almighty has given you because it will all come back to you one day!

Almighty. We ask You to forgive all our sins. You know how much we have transgressed and the countless sins we have committed. Do not take us to account for our lack of attention. Do not punish us for messing up repeatedly. Continue to be patient with us. Have mercy on us! Aameen

In this age of social media, everyone wants overnight fame and instant gratification. Nobody wants to do the hard work. The truth is hard work is the prerequisite. Else nothing is achieved. Don‚Äôt let anyone tell you otherwise. We need to face the brokenness in order to shine.

Never tear someone down to build yourself up. You may enjoy momentary bliss but that‚Äôs all; it won‚Äôt last! We may not realize but we tear others down by laughing at them & the things they do, especially when they make mistakes. Stop this! The tables can & will turn. Wait for it!

Stop comparing your marriage to what you see online. Couples post pictures making it look like they‚Äôre having a perpetual honeymoon and you fall for it. You get miserable. Wake up. Real life isn‚Äôt like that. Besides, envy is dangerous. Disastrous even; so get offline & on track.

Upholding the ties of kinship is important & severing them is a sin. Use this blessed month to mend  whatever is cracked or broken. Don‚Äôt wait. You‚Äôre missing out on a lot of blessings if you let bad feelings fester between family and relatives. Go on; make the first move!

You‚Äôre on the verge of giving up because you can‚Äôt stand the pain. You‚Äôre wondering if the Almighty is aware of what you‚Äôre going through. Never doubt He‚Äôs All-Knowing, All-Seeing. Remember, you might be experiencing tremendous pain but the result will be beautiful! Trust Him!

Count your blessings instead of your problems. Do that often; you‚Äôll emerge the winner. You‚Äôll find pathways charted for you. The Almighty will grant you strength in times of need, peace in chaos, joy in sadness and hope in hopelessness. The Lord of the Worlds won‚Äôt disappoint!

Whatever you want to do, do it soonest possible. Don‚Äôt wait for the perfect time, the perfect moment, the perfect day. It doesn‚Äôt exist. Perfection is not for this world. So before you end up miserable because you‚Äôve been stuck waiting, act on it. Let the Almighty be your Guide.

The truth is people will talk about you and there‚Äôs not much you can do about it. Don‚Äôt throw yourself into emotional turmoil when you hear what they‚Äôre saying. Remember, the problem is theirs, not yours. If you feel the need to defend yourself against a lie, do it calmly!

Plug in with the Almighty wholeheartedly. Do it consciously. Don‚Äôt let worldly affairs get in the way. Cut off all the distractions in your path. Those who try to lead you astray. Those who waste your time. Let them all go. Life‚Äôs too short to be engaging in futile activities.

If their success intimidates or upsets you, then you have a problem. You‚Äôre not fully focused on your own journey. You‚Äôre also letting ego get in the way. Learn to disengage from what others are doing or not doing. Pay no attention to their harsh words too. Mind your own journey.

#Ramadan is a very blessed month. Don‚Äôt waste it. Give it your all. Losing out would be foolish as you may not see the next one. Let us strive to make this the best month. The Almighty has promised forgiveness & huge rewards if you fast solely for His sake. Paradise awaits you.

Don‚Äôt ignore what you think are the small things in life. They could be the ones that bring you the greatest benefit. Don‚Äôt take things for granted. The Almighty puts everything in your life for a reason; to fulfill a purpose. Read the signs. Often you‚Äôre too busy to see them.

You don‚Äôt need the solution to everything. Some questions don‚Äôt need answers & they‚Äôre better left that way. You just need a firm heart, full of trust and firm belief. A heart full of love & peace. You‚Äôll be amazed at how much more you can get out of the unspoken than just words!

You‚Äôre feeling ill at ease because you think your life is lacking what you see others have on social media. Don‚Äôt fall for this. Understand that not every voice you hear and every post you see on social media is for you. Learn to be discerning. Protect your clarity of mind!

Looking at the positives when calamity strikes is not for the faint-hearted. You need to have a solid link with your Maker. You understand that difficult times help move you forward. Struggle and strife are standard life lessons. Embrace them and see things in perspective!

Every chapter in your life serves a purpose. Yes, even the ‚Äòbad‚Äô ones. The Almighty never wastes anything that He puts you through. So whenever you feel hopeless or alone, close your eyes; remember that He‚Äôs with you. He will never abandon you. Trust that better days are coming!

Whatever you‚Äôre going through, don‚Äôt quit. Carry on with the journey knowing that something better awaits you. Because He has promised ease after hardship. That should be a good enough reason. When you get through it, you‚Äôre going to be stronger, wiser and more resilient!

Almighty. Keep us far away from obscene speech, ignorant acts, argument and insults, not just because we‚Äôre fasting but because they incur Your Wrath. Such actions are often intended to offend, intimidate, cause emotional upheaval etc. Let‚Äôs clean up our acts. #Ramadan

We are not perfect. We are a work in progress. We will continue to make mistakes. But that‚Äôs part of the process. Don‚Äôt start doubting yourself and your ability. Be kinder to yourself. Allow yourself some leeway. Be guided by the Almighty always and have a blessed journey!

When the Almighty makes us wait, there‚Äôs wisdom in it. Don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a punishment. It could be a protection or perhaps, preparation. Always think good thoughts because He always wants the best for us. It may not be what we envisaged but it‚Äôs what we need at that point in time!

Don't be so easily deceived by this worldly life. It‚Äôs full of trickery. It will sap your energy & leave you totally exhausted. If & when you eventually get what you want, you‚Äôd have to forgo some aspects of your life. Keep your faith intact! That is non-negotiable at all times!

Focus on yourself. Mind your own business. Don‚Äôt start comparing and spoil every blessing you have. Remember, your grass will never get greener by focusing on someone else's lawn. Water your own. Nurture your own. Refocus your energy on your blessings. You‚Äôll reach your goals!

Let #Ramadan calm you and soothe you. Your soul needs it. Let it cleanse you and purify you and remind you of the countless blessings the Almighty has sent your way. Let your heart be filled with gratitude. Let it soften even more as you do what it takes to get closer to Him!

When you are suffering, your mind is egging you on to make the suffering work for you to propel you on your path. It‚Äôs egging you on to resolve the issue through lojong until it‚Äôs no longer troubling your heart.

When you wake up in the middle of the night chewing on yesterday‚Äôs interactions that made you feel hurt or mistreated, this is the time to use your lojong. Time to sit up and do the four immeasurables. Time to sit up and do tonglen. Time to sit up and reverse your psychology.
The great sage, Atisha, describes the practice of lojong, or mind training, as a soothing soup. When you drink it, it soothes you and nourishes you to the core.
If you want to engage in lojong, in mind training, you must welcome all that comes your way.

3 ~ When we are in pain, that very swirling self rises in our chest out of obscurity. This is known as the 7th consciousness. Afflictive consciousness: because it is found to be the cause of cherishing and protecting itself. It is sort of the symbol of the three poisons.

Being Ordinary

All people have enlightened nature. Everyone‚Äôs hearts are innately imbued with tsewa. Why not cherish what you have in common with all beings rather than make yourself insecure by trying so hard to be special, somehow better than everyone else?

When someone reacts negatively to you or gives you strong feedback, they are speaking to your obscurations, not to your enlightened nature. So feedback can be positive if you admit to your obscurations. Feedback supports your practice of self-reflection.

You have no reason to get angry if you are not feeling threatened. Anger is a self-protection that seeks to conquer, avert or abolish the threat. But those ruin our well-being in the end. So there is ‚Äúdeep mental fog‚Äù in the aggression that prevents us from thinking clearly.
Failure keeps you honest and makes you a better practitioner.

According to Candrakirti, enlightenment has two causes. A universal, unbiased love for all sentient beings and the realization of the wisdom of non-duality.

Peace is a result of training in tenderness. A peaceful heart needs to be protected by some form of patience or tolerance as we rise from our practice of the Four Immeasurables and go about our day.

I use the word ‚Äútender‚Äù( in "tender-heartedness") because there is a deep feeling of softness and opening and gentleness that pours out when we attempt to enhance someone‚Äôs welfare. Tender describes that experience of loving-kindness and compassion practice.

Our emotions of compassion need to be guided by universal reasoning or wisdom, for example, how all living beings wish to be happy and free from suffering. That logic supports us to practice equanimity hand-in-hand with our compassion, making our compassion that much larger.
The practice of patience protects our warm-heartedness and the love and care we wish to extend to all beings without exception. One sustains our well-being while the other preserves it.

One must imagine Sisyphus happy.

‚Äì Albert Camus

This universe henceforth without a master seems to him neither sterile nor futile. Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself, forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. 

‚Ä¶

I leave Sisyphus at the foot of the mountain. One always finds one's burden again. But Sisyphus teaches the higher fidelity that negates the gods and raises rocks. He too concludes that all is well.
